description: This is the primary site to network on and also they have job postings.  They have a system to take in job applications with LinkedIn Easy Apply.  They are also a business-oriented social media site
reviews: It's good for professional networking, not everyone likes it.
notes: I've spent a lot of time applying for jobs and trying to network and build posts on this site.   I haven't gotten any serious inquiries off this site yet, though it has been my main place to
networking: Yes, this is probably the best site for professional networking
privacyAndSecurity: You have to be careful, there seems like there's some funny business that could happen on this site.

description: This is a job board linked with the Alumni Ventures venture capital group.  They have a number of different start-ups in different fields.
notes: This seems like a good place to occassionally check for jobs.  Right now, there doesn't seem to be a lot of fresh software engineering positions listed as of January 2024.
networking: Yes - seems like there could be some.

description: This site has a lot of jobs posted, but it seems like not everyone has a high rate of success.  It seems "spammy" for some reason.
reviews: OK, not sure it will actually lead to anything.
notes: Good for putting in applications and LinkedIn often routes to this site with some of their listings.
resourcesOffered: resume evaluation, ai tools look for lots of jobs
privacyAndSecurity: Seems like it could be low.

accountInfo: Experienced Software Engineer and product developer.
description: You can get short term contract work from this site.
reviews: I haven't read any other reviews or heard of any Codesmith Grads jusing it.
notes: I'd like to get some work from this site to get more experience.  It seems like there are a lot of people applying on this site and in Fall of 2023 there were very few opportunities.  It seems lately like they've picked-up, so would be worthwhile looking into again.
resourcesOffered: They can help you find work, supposedly
costOrFees: Yes - you buy a certain amount of credits to submit proposals for work.
privacyAndSecurity: It's not clear how good it is.

description: This is a site that deals primarily with start-ups.
reviews: I haven't seen any, I've heard of some grads getting interviews based on this site.
notes: I'm not sure how good this site is yet as I haven't used it much.  It hasn't resulted in many leads yet, but I haven't been that active on it either.  I should put in more applications with it.
networking: It seems possible - there's a messaging feature.

description: Indeed is a popular job search engine that aggregates job listings from thousands of websites, including job boards, staffing firms, associations, and company career pages. Users can upload their resumes, create profiles, and apply for jobs directly through Indeed. It also offers services like resume storage, job search alerts, and company reviews to help job seekers get a comprehensive understanding of the available opportunities and companies. Additionally, Indeed provides a variety of tools and resources, like salary comparisons and employment trend analyses, to assist job seekers in making informed career decisions. For employers, Indeed offers a platform for posting job openings and a suite of recruiting services to find and hire candidates.
notes: I haven't used it yet, it didn't come up really in our Codesmith job search coaching.  I need to review what Codesmith said about it.

description: A platform focusing on helping clients find and retain diverse talent. Offers a dynamic job board, information about job fairs, conferences, and various employers.
Bills itself as 'the premier IT job board', focusing on a relationship-based approach to match job candidates with companies.
A smaller, community-based job site focusing on startup needs, offering various job opportunities and connections with new startups.
A site for software developers looking for remote work with a simple job search function and unique job opportunities.
The TechCrunch jobs board widely used by tech companies to fill open positions, with an attractive interface and regularly updated listings.
A tech-centric job site with powerful search features, offering job listings, career research help, and advice on resumes and interviews.
A site specifically for software developers focusing on Android apps, offering a variety of Android Developer positions.
A career growth platform offering tools and resources for job searching, including resume building, job tracking, and community support.
They have a big job board with jobs from around the world.
notes: I haven't tried this site yet, but will in the near future.

description: There are several job postings as of 1/17/2024.
notes: It looks like there is a good amount of jobs posted here.
This is another VC firm with a job board.
This is a venture capital firm job board.
This is a VC firm job board.

description: A well known VC firm that helps start-ups.
reviews: Many different companies have used Y Combinator.  Probably a good place to put in applications for start-ups.
notes: This is probably a good site to start using.

description: They look like they have many job postings - not clear how many remote positions are there though.
notes: I need to use it more before I can give it a more detailed review/rating.
